Then, you are running the v1.10.5, please upgrade to v1.10.6 which contains a consensus hotfix for the london hard fork.
Also, we recommend you to use snap sync(`syncmode snap`) for the initial sync. It's expected to be faster then fast sync.

Blockchain is a tree of blocks. So it mean you can create a block(side block) based on an ancient block and assign the mining reward to yourself. You can successfully do it since the difficulty for mining such block is very low and your machine can handle it. But this block is not part of the canonical block which is recognized by the network. After the restart, Geth does some chain rewind to follow the canonical chain. In this canonical state your mining reward is not existent so the RPC returns 0 balance for your account.

I would recommend to disable mining only if the chain is synced.
